rationales.achievement: Allowed Felix to present his preprocessing idea as his own without claiming credit, actively forgoing competence recognition.
rationales.power: Ceded status and influence by staying silent while someone else took credit for his work — 'biting my tongue' rather than asserting control.
rationales.conformity: Bit his tongue through the entire lab meeting to avoid disrupting social harmony, despite having clear grounds to object.

rationales.self_direction: Rejected a well-connected lab placement to build his own project — 'My project, my call' — prioritizing autonomy over career safety.
rationales.security: Turned down a stable, advisor-arranged placement with strong career benefits, choosing uncertainty; his mother's argument about doors opening is a security case he explicitly rejects.
rationales.conformity: Defied expectations of advisor, peers, and family by rejecting the placement; avoids telling family because he knows it violates their norms.
rationales.tradition: Rejected the path his parents mapped out and the traditional mentor-student authority structure by turning down his advisor's arranged placement.

rationales.self_direction: Insists on building his own pipeline from scratch and reflexively refuses help — 'refusing help because I need it to be entirely mine.'
rationales.hedonism: Stayed up until 4 AM debugging, actively sacrificing sleep and comfort for the sake of keeping full ownership of the project.
rationales.security: Falling behind on coursework and hasn't started a fellowship application due Friday, destabilizing his academic standing.
rationales.conformity: Cannot write himself as a team player without it 'feeling like a lie'; recognizes he does not conform to expected collaborative academic norms.
rationales.benevolence: Reflexively rejected Nina's offer of help — 'I said no before I even thought about it' — shutting down a collegial caring interaction despite acknowledging it was 'stupid.'
